# @axe-devtools/reporter

axe DevTools Reporter is a set of tools for creating HTML and XML reports from the output of an axe DevTools integration (for example, puppeteer and webdriverjs).

## Installation

To install the `@axe-devtools/reporter` package, run the following command:

```
npm install @axe-devtools/reporter --registry https://agora.dequecloud.com/artifactory/api/npm/devtools-npm
```

**NOTE** it is expected that you're setup your `~/.npmrc` as specified by Deque University.

## Node API

The `@axe-devtools/reporter` package exports an API for creating a Reporter. To use the Node.js API in your project, you can `require()` and instantiate the package like so:

```js
const Reporter = require('@axe-devtools/reporter').default;

const reporter = new Reporter('My Report', '/path/to/a/directory');
```

Additionally, you can `import` the package using ES6 modules:

```js
import Reporter from '@axe-devtools/reporter';
```

_NOTE: for the most up-to-date documentation, please refer to the generated TypeScript definitions (`dist/index.d.ts`)._

### new Reporter(name: string, outputDirectory: string)

Create an `Reporter` instance.

### Reporter#getTestResults(userAgent: string): TestResult[]

Get an array of axe DevTools test results.

### Reporter#logTestResult(id: string, finding: TestResult, options: Object): void

Log the given `finding` with the specified `id` and `options`.

### Reporter#buildHTML(directory: string, userAgent: string): Promise<void>

Build an HTML report and save it to the given `directory`.

### Reporter#buildJUnitXML(directory: string, userAgent: string):Promise<void>

Build an XML report and save it to the given `directory`.

### Reporter#buildCSV(directory: string, userAgent: string):Promise<void>

Build a CSV report and save it to the given `directory`.

## Memory usage

Memory usage varies based on the input. Normal usage should be below 500MB; but
large reports may exceed that.
